rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Going in, I was afraid to take a 1:15 French class, but she always managed to keep it engaging and interesting. Readings are not too demanding. Just be sure to always go to class or else your participation grade will plummet, along with the rest of it.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: One of the most intelligent and understanding professors I've had at UNC. I had her my freshman year for 255 and am desperately trying to take another of her classes. She cares a lot about her students and allows rewrites on all papers and many projects

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Great professor. Class is not necessarily easy but very rewarding in that if you put in the work you can get an A no problem. Very smart guy who knows his stuff and isn't too concerned about usual class formalities. Definitely take if you get the chance.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. Fisher is WONDERFUL. I am currently taking 377 with her, and am basing my class choices for next semester off of what classes she is teaching. She is easily approachable, and is willing to help out students. She is lenient with the due dates for reading forums, as she understands that we are students with busy lives. WOULD RECOMMEND!!!

Lots of reading and spends most of the class lecturing about said reading. A little bit confusing as to what she's looking for so students hesitate to speak and the class ends up being awkwardly quiet. Still, she really appreciates when students participate and as long as you do the assignments and speak in class she grades pretty generously.

Dr. Fisher is AMAZING. This is the third class I'm taking with her and she is the reason I'm taking the course! Regardless of what class you take with her, you WILL come out with a good grade if you just attend class! Her classes always have a presentation, 2 papers and final essay. She doesn't take off points for grammar & is super nice & helpful!
Prof. Fisher is the best French prof at UNC. She is up to date when it comes to current topics in French but she is still able to teach obscure 19th century texts. I love her!

I've taken two of her classes and she's a little boring, but the topics are very relevant and she does a thorough job with them. 2 papers, a presentation and a final. Lots of movies and a decent amount of reading, but you can get by with just skimming and paying decent attention in class.
